name: Energy Overload
title: Highest Energy Consumption Per Capita
description: In 2022, Qatar had the highest energy use per capita in the world, with each person consuming 16,683.66 kg of oil equivalent.

name: Internet for All
title: Universal Male Internet Usage
description: By 2020, 100% of the male population in Qatar was using the internet, showcasing the country's advanced digital infrastructure.

name: Savings Galore
title: Top Gross Domestic Savings
description: In 2022, Qatar's gross domestic savings reached 67.63% of its GDP, one of the highest globally, reflecting strong economic health.

name: Wealthy Nation
title: Highest GNI Per Capita
description: Qatar's GNI per capita was $125,240 in 2023, making it one of the wealthiest nations per individual globally.

name: Employment Powerhouse
title: High Male Employment Ratio
description: In 2024, 95.52% of males aged 15+ were employed in Qatar, indicating a robust job market for men.

name: Gender Parity in Education
title: High Tertiary Education Gender Parity Index
description: In 2022, Qatar's tertiary education gender parity index was 1.79, indicating more females than males enrolled in higher education.

name: Tourism Expenditure
title: Significant Tourism Expenditure
description: In 2020, international tourism expenditures accounted for 19.48% of Qatar's total imports, highlighting the country's tourism appeal.

name: Consumer Caution
title: Lowest Household Consumption
description: In 2022, household consumption in Qatar was only 19.5% of GDP, indicating a cautious consumer spending pattern compared to global standards.

name: Eco-Friendly Nation
title: Minimal Forest Depletion
description: Qatar reported virtually no net forest depletion in 2021, showcasing its commitment to preserving natural resources.

name: Safe Water, Safe Lives
title: Low Mortality from Unsafe Water
description: With a mortality rate of just 0.4 per 100,000 due to unsafe water and sanitation in 2019, Qatar ensures a healthy environment for its citizens.

name: Urban Dwellers
title: Predominantly Urban Population
description: In 2023, only 0.65% of Qatar's population resided in rural areas, highlighting its urban-centric development.

name: Youthful Workforce
title: Low Youth Unemployment
description: In 2024, youth male unemployment was a mere 0.098%, reflecting strong employment opportunities for young Qataris.

name: Stable Employment
title: Low Vulnerable Employment
description: In 2023, only 12.6% of the workforce was in vulnerable employment, indicating job stability in Qatar.

name: Balanced Demographics
title: Low Age Dependency Ratio
description: With an age dependency ratio of 20.1% in 2023, Qatar enjoys a balanced demographic structure, supporting economic growth.

name: Gender Employment Equality
title: Low Female Agricultural Employment
description: In 2023, only 1.5% of female employment was in agriculture, reflecting diverse job opportunities for women in Qatar.

name: Advanced Education Advantage
title: Low Unemployment with Advanced Education
description: In 2021, unemployment among males with advanced education was just 0.16%, indicating effective utilization of skilled labor.

name: Part-Time Rarity
title: Minimal Part-Time Employment
description: In 2020, only 1.55% of the workforce was engaged in part-time employment, suggesting a preference for full-time roles.
